intro: Peucedanum kamiesbergense, commonly known as the Namibian angelica, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important species in its native habitat.
